label: Using Git/GitHub
description: Was the student able to succssfully fork a repository, commit and push changes?

label: Simple web-page
description: Did the student complete the required steps to build the components a simple HTML web-page

label: Deployment
description: Was the student able to deploy the files to the student web-server?

label: Completeness
description: Did the student complete all the required steps? How complete is the overall solution?

label: Functionality
description: How well does the solution function? Does it produce errors or function incorrectly?

label: Implementation
description: How well-written is the code? Is the HTML properly indented and easy to read? Do the CSS class names make sense?

label: Completeness
description: Did the student complete all the required steps? How complete is the overall solution?

label: Functionality
description: How well does the solution function? Does it produce errors or function incorrectly?

label: Implementation
description: How well-written is the code? Is the HTML properly indented and easy to read? Do the CSS class names make sense?

label: Baseline requirements
description: Did the student build a responsive form using angular, and leverage directives to display retrieved data?

label: Creativity
description: Did the student stretch their skills to build an interesting web application using the Spotify data?

label: UI
description: Did the student build a modern user-interface for their application?  Are web standards (i.e., bootstrap) employed?

label: UX
description: Does the site behave as expected?  Is the page interactivity intuitive and easy to use?

label: Implementation
description: Is the code clearly written and optimized?  Is Angular properly leveraged for retrieving data and building the application?

label: Library selection
description: Did the group select a useful JavaScript library, and articulate that usefulness to the class?

label: Clarity
description: Did the group clearly communicate the purpose of the pacakge, as well as how to implement it?

label: Exercise
description: Did the group create an exercise that demonstrated how to use the package?

label: Group work
description: Did all members of the group contribute to creating and presenting the materials?

label: Functionality
description: How well does the website function?  Was it build using proper mobile response principles?

label: UX
description: How is the user experience?  Does the site use a layout and leverage familiar navigation elements?

label: Implementation
description: How well-written is the code? Is the HTML properly indented and easy to read? Do the CSS class names make sense? Is the JavaScript well-organized, optimized, and commented?

label: Originality
description: How original or innovative is the project?

label: Completeness
description: Did the student create a map with multiple layers and varying visual features (i.e., size and color of points)?  Is the cross tabulation table populated? Is sufficient background information provided?

label: Functionality
description: Does the map load at an appropriate zoom level, provide information about each point on click, and have the ability to add and remove layers?

label: Implementation
description: How well-written is the code? Does the student efficiently loop through data to create different features (i.e., layers and points)?

label: User Experience
description: Did the student pay sufficient attention to elements of user experience (page layout, colors used, etc.)?

label: Summary
description: Did the student provide a summary of the group work?

label: Self evaluation
description: Did the student provide a self evaluation?

label: Peer evaluation
description: Did the student provide an evaluation of each other group member?
